main event: One white object with a tail traveled across the sky and slowly disintegrated as it descended on 22 March 1962.
interesting points: The object had a tail about 15 times wider than its main body., The sighting lasted for approximately 3-5 seconds., The object traveled in a straight line at a tremendous speed before disintegrating., The evaluation suggested it was possibly a balloon but concluded insufficient data for a definitive answer., The sighting occurred off the Oregon Coast.
sighted object: a white object with a large tail
witness description: Captain Billy B. Coggen, pilot, and 1st Sergeant Payne, fit engineer, both considered reliable.
